cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 300 miles ESE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, then northwest to north-northwest toward the north-central Gulf Coast (southeast Louisiana–Mississippi shoreline)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast near the mouth of the Mississippi River to Ocean Springs, Mississippi

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch east of Ocean Springs MS to the Alabama/Florida border; Storm Surge Watch MS/AL border to AL/FL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Grand Isle LA to Ocean Springs MS including Lake Pontchartrain & Lake Maurepas; Storm Surge Warning Port Fourchon LA to the MS/AL border including Lakes
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39-73 mph) expected to begin late Monday with potential hurricane-force gusts if Sally strengthens further before landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 4–7 ft possible from Port Fourchon to the mouth of the Mississippi River, with 4–6 ft in Lake Pontchartrain and Maurepas — posing a significant flooding threat along the river-side facilities of the Port of South Louisiana.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches of rain with isolated totals up to 20 inches, creating a high risk of flash and river flooding that can disrupt terminal access and cargo movements.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents, possible river back-water rise along the Mississippi River, and prolonged port closure or restricted operations due to sustained gale conditions.
